summary.reasoning: The 7% royalty percentage was chosen based on industry standards for sustainability initiatives and product reuse projects, where the value addition justifies a lower royalty rate compared to high-tech or patented innovations. The growth projections follow a steady industry growth pattern in automotive accessory sectors, factoring in increasing demand for sustainable practices and parts reuse. The consistent increase in unit sales aligns with expected market expansion and adoption of circular business models.
summary.market_assumptions: The market assumes a growing trend towards sustainability and cost-efficient solutions in vehicle manufacturing, with increasing regulatory and consumer pressures to reduce waste and emissions.
summary.industry_standards: Royalty rates in the automotive accessory industry typically range from 5% to 15%, with lower rates applied to high-volume, low-margin products and higher rates for innovative or patented technologies.

comparable_projects.name: Michelin's Tire Recycling Initiative
comparable_projects.description: A project by Michelin to recycle and reuse tire materials, contributing to sustainability goals.

royalty_model.details: Applied to the sale of recycled tire materials to partners and manufacturers.

comparable_projects.name: Ford's Closed-Loop Recycling
comparable_projects.description: Ford Motor Company's initiative to recycle aluminum scrap in production, reducing waste and costs.

royalty_model.details: Royalties from partners using Ford's recycled materials in their production process.

comparable_projects.name: Toyota's Hybrid Battery Recycling
comparable_projects.description: Toyota's program to recycle and reuse components of hybrid batteries, creating a sustainable cycle.

royalty_model.details: Royalty based on the resale of recycled battery components to third-party manufacturers.

methodology.data_sources: Industry reports, BMW Group's financial disclosures, and market analysis reports from 2020-2023.
methodology.assumptions: Assumes a stable economic environment and continued regulatory support for sustainable automotive practices. Growth projections are based on historical sales data and expected adoption rates of circular economy models.
